data.title: Dividing watermelon
data.statement:
One hot summer day Ali and Abu decided to buy a watermelon. The watermelon was weighed, and the scales showed [[w]] kilos. They rushed home, dying of thirst, and decided to divide the berry, however they faced a hard problem.

Ali and Abu are great fans of even numbers, that's why they want to divide the watermelon in such a way that each of the <<two>> parts weighs <<even>> number of kilos. The boys are extremely tired and want to start their meal as soon as possible, that's why you should help them and find out how many ways they can divide the watermelon in the way they want. For sure, each of them should get a part of positive weight.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1>>: An integer [[w]] for the weight of the watermelon in kilos
data.outputDescription: Print the number of ways the boys can divide the watermelon, such that each of them get a part with positive even weight.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

One hot summer day Ali and Abu decided to buy a watermelon. The watermelon was weighed, and the scales showed w kilos. They rushed home, dying of thirst, and decided to divide the berry, however they faced a hard problem.

Ali and Abu are great fans of even numbers, that's why they want to divide the watermelon in such a way that each of the two parts weighs even number of kilos. The boys are extremely tired and want to start their meal as soon as possible, that's why you should help them and find out how many ways they can divide the watermelon in the way they want. For sure, each of them should get a part of positive weight.
Input
Line 1: An integer w for the weight of the watermelon in kilos
Output
Print the number of ways the boys can divide the watermelon, such that each of them get a part with positive even weight.
Constraints
1 ≤ w ≤ 100
Example
Input
8
Output
3
